## Readings
#### Required
- **[Joshua D Angrist and Steve Pischke. Mastering 'Metrics. 2015, Ch. 3](Classes/Class_6/Readings/Angrist and Pischke Ch.3.pdf)**
- **[Sovey, Alison and Donald P. Green (2010), Instrumental Variables Estimation in Political Science: A Readers' Guide, American Journal of Political Science](Sovey and Green.pdf)**
- **[Dunning, Thad (2012), Natural Experiments in the Social Sciences: A Design-Based Approach, Cambridge University Press, Ch. 4](Classes/Class_6/Readings/Dunning Natural Experiments IV.pdf)**
- **[Acemoglu, Johnson and Robinson, The Colonial Origins of Comparative Development: An Empirical Investigation](Classes/Class_6/Readings/AJR 2001.pdf)**

#### Additional Readings
- [Mostly Harmless Econometrics, Ch.4 ](Classes/Class_6/Readings/Angrist and Pischke Ch.4.pdf)
- [Deaton, Angus S. (2009), Instruments of Development: Ranomization in the Tropics, and the Search for the Elusive Keys to Economic Development](Classes/Class_6/Readings/Deaton 2009.pdf)
- [Guido W. Imbens and Donald B Rubin. Causal Inference for Statistics, Social, and Biomedical Sciences. 2015. Ch. 23](Classes/Class_6/Readings/Imbens and Rubin IV.pdf)
